Posts.Content: CapeTownJanine wrote: Good morning ladies, After a long absence from these boards, unfortunately I find myself back here. I was initially diagnosed at age 31 in Feb 2007, and underwent a left mastectomy, chemo and radiation for ILC. Been on tamoxifen since then. At the end of March, I went for my 5 year checkup. I was so excited, as I was certain this was the end for me. Unfortunately extensive bone mets have been identified. I'm scheduled for my first Zometa treatment next week, and wanted to know how I can prepare, and what to expect? Thank you in advance, Janine Initial dx: Feb 2007; tx: Mastectomy, Chemo, Radiation, Tamoxifen. Bone Mets dx Mar 2012; tx: Ooph, Radiation Dx 2/16/2007, ILC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 3/30/2012, ILC, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Starting Zometa soon CapeTownJanine Marj2007
